Metadata: Growth inhibition by glucose oxidase of selected organisms associated with the microbial spoilage of shrimp ("Pandalus jordani"): in vitro model studies

The objective of this study was to evaluate the effectiveness of GOX/CAT (glucose oxidase/catalasâ€‹e) solutions with different GOX/CAT ratios on the growth inhibition of four microorganisms usually found in shrimp. The GOX/CAT mode of action on the inhibition of these microrganisms ("Pseudomonas fluorescens", "Acinetobacter calcoaceticum", "Corynebacter aquaticum", and "Hansenula polymorpha") was also investigated.
